A 55-year-old male alcoholic is brought to the emergency room by his wife because he started to vomit bright red blood at home. Over the past year, he has frequently complained of abdominal pain while eating a meal, and, as such, has lost about 40 lbs. He has no past medical history and is on no medications. He consumes about 1 beer per day and has a 10-pack per-year history of smoking. Of the following, what is the most likely source of his bleeding? (unsure)

A 55-year-old male has had abdominal pain for about 4 months. His physician has prescribed omeprazole, which has not apparently worked. He sought consult again, this time complaining of a nodule at his umbilicus. He has no other significant past medical history. Biopsy of the nodule reveals neoplastic cells with a signet ring appearance. He undergoes an exploratory laparotomy. Of the following, which is the surgeon likely to find?

choices.b: Diffuse thickening of the wall of the stomach
choices.c: A red and yellow mass in the cortex of a kidney
choices.d: An ulcerated mass in the large intestine
